Legal_Issue: Does the Refugee Appeal Division (RAD) owe deference to Refugee Protection Division (RPD) findings of fact and mixed fact and law?
Application_Facts: Meilina's claim was denied by RPD due to an internal flight alternative. RAD upheld this using reasonableness standard. Federal Court found Meilina did not receive proper appeal.
Decision_Outcome: Judicial review granted, RAD decision set aside and remitted for redetermination.
Application_Basis: Refugee status based on risk if returned
Governing_Rule: RAD reviews RPD decisions under its statutory framework. Deference depends on whether findings are questions of fact, law, or mixed fact and law.
Outcome: RAD decision overturned, remitted for new determination
Decisional_Body: Refugee Protection Division (RPD), Refugee Appeal Division (RAD), Federal Court
Cause_Description: Meilina claimed refugee status but was denied due to an internal flight alternative.
Decision_Rationale: RAD applied reasonableness standard; Federal Court found appeal improper
Decision_Making_Body: Refugee Protection Division, Refugee Appeal Division
